meanings.sent1: The tornado razees the small town, leaving nothing standing.
meanings.sent2: The old building was razed to make way for a new shopping center.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy razees the garden by digging up all the flowers.
meanings.sent4: The wildfire razees through the forest, consuming everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The demolition crew razees the abandoned warehouse with explosives, creating a cloud of dust.

meanings.definition: Razees (noun): ships that have been cut down to reduce the number of decks
meanings.sent1: The navy used razees in battles due to their speed and maneuverability.
meanings.sent2: The historical museum displayed a model of the razees used in the 18th century.
meanings.sent3: The captain proudly showed off his collection of miniature razees to the crew.
meanings.sent4: The razees lined up in formation, ready to set sail for their next mission.
meanings.sent5: The sailors admired the intricate carvings on the razees' bowsprit.
